result.execSummary:
The defendant LeRoy A. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. LeRoy A. Butler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • LeRoy A. Butler was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 11, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF480.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  LeRoy A. Butler appeared.  Court called at 10:53 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to simple possession of THC.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Court amends Ct. 1 to simple possession of THC.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1.   Crt  finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2.  Crt orders:

-  S/W 1 year probation with conditions
-  AODA with follow through
-  Absolute sobriety: zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Court costs of $243 payable through the DOC
-  Report to probation today 03/11/2015/bail is continued until DE reports
-  20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on March 11, 2015 at 10:45 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Vicki G. Kasten, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: LeRoy A. Butler appeared.  Court called at 4:03 p.m. Attorney Kucinski advises the court there is no agreement.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 4:06 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  LeRoy A. Butler appeared. Case set for 2:00 pm and called at 2:34 p.m. Mr. Butler was running late. Court reviews charges and maximum penalties with def. Def plead not guilty to both counts.  Bail continues. Speedy trial waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
State's. Filed by ADA Hahn. hml
